The organ of the face used to breath and smell.
The organ of smell and entrance to the respiratory tract; the prominent part of the face of man or other mammals

Noses are an organ on the face, and in particular a protuberance in vertebrates that houses the nostrils, which admit and expel air for respiration in conjunction with the mouth, and also house receptors for detecting smells.
Anatomically, a nose is a protuberance in vertebrates that houses the nostrils, or nares, which admit and expel air for respiration in conjunction with the mouth.
Protuberance on the face.
Organ that smells and facilitates breathing
A protuberance on the face housing the nostrils, which are used to breathe or smell.
Any smell, whether fragrant or offensive; scent; perfume.
The sensation that results when olfactory receptors in the nose are stimulated by particular chemicals in gaseous form
A scent that is being emitted by something
The property of a substance affecting the sense of smell.
An odor or odour or fragrance is caused by one or more volatilized chemical compounds, generally at a very low concentration, that humans or other animals perceive by the sense of olfaction.
Thing sensed by smell
That which is perceived by the nasal organs.

The light skin tone is rendered with smooth gradients, giving it a natural and approachable appearance.
